title-group.article-title: Realized Returns on Common Stock Investments: The Experience of Individual Investors

abstract.p: Virtually all existing empirical studies of the American capital market deal with the investment performance record of institutions. The present paper offers data on the investment experiences of a large and representative sample of individual investors, based on a 7-year history of actual trading behavior. Those experiences suggest some reasonable skill in security selection, particularly in connection with short-term trading cycles. Transactions costs, however, have a substantial impact on realized net returns, rendering the overall performance results observed similar to those available from passive investment strategies over corresponding calendar periods.
